backend/main.mo: Motoko canister managing user profiles with access control plus public contact-form submissions and an admin-only retrieval function.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping theme, layout, animation, and styling updates to affected frontend files and components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the purpose of each major frontend file including components, hooks, styles, and configuration.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind-based light-theme style tokens and base element styling including color variables and dark-mode overrides.
frontend/index.html: Main HTML entry file defining metadata, fonts, and root mount point for the React app.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component assembling all sections, decorative elements, navigation, footer, and admin panel within a light gradient layout.
frontend/src/components/admin/AdminPanel: Shows a floating admin-panel trigger for authenticated Internet Identity users and opens a sheet containing admin tools.
frontend/src/components/admin/AdminSubmi: Fetches and displays contact form submissions for admins, handling loading, permission checks, and formatted submission cards.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Provides a login/logout button using Internet Identity with status handling and query cache clearing.
Interactive cursor‑tracking spotlight effect that activates on desktop unless reduced motion is preferred.
frontend/src/components/DecorativeBackgr: Static background layer rendering decorative shapes, gradients, and light-theme accents behind the page content.
frontend/src/components/GlassCard.tsx: Reusable light glassmorphism card wrapper with blur, soft shadows, and optional hover lift animation.
frontend/src/components/sections/AboutSe: Renders an 'About Me' section with scroll-reveal animation and descriptive text inside a GlassCard.
frontend/src/components/sections/Contact: Implements a contact form with validation, submission via hook, error handling, and scroll reveal animation.
frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSec: Displays the landing hero section with parallax effects, social links, text content, and smooth-scroll CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/sections/Project: Shows a grid of featured projects with images, descriptions, tags, and external links using scroll-reveal effects.
frontend/src/components/sections/SkillsS: Presents a grid of skill icons and labels with staggered scroll-reveal animation.
frontend/src/components/TopNav.tsx: Sticky responsive navigation bar with smooth scrolling, mobile sheet menu, and light-theme blur and shadow styling.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor and invalidates dependent queries when it changes.
Provides a mutation for submitting contact form data through the actor and tracks submission states.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Manages Internet Identity authentication state, providing login, logout, and identity context.
frontend/src/hooks/useParallax.ts: Computes a scroll‑based parallax offset with reduced‑motion support.
frontend/src/hooks/usePrefersReducedMoti: Returns whether the user’s system requests reduced motion and updates on preference changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exposes queries for fetching all contact submissions and checking admin status via the actor.
frontend/src/hooks/useScrollReveal.ts: Provides a ref and visibility flag using IntersectionObserver for scroll‑reveal animations.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles, theme variables, utilities, animations, and accessibility rules.
frontend/src/lib/validation.ts: Contains simple validators for required fields and email format.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utilities for reading, persisting, and clearing URL and session‑based parameters.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration extending colors, shadows, animations, and theme settings.
project_state.json: Stores the project’s current state, including theme requirements, architectural notes, image needs, known conflicts, and existing feature definitions for the portfolio site.
